alert.note: Alert for Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 11:35AM CDT until October 25 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Callahan, Coleman and Shackelford. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1133 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from O.H. Ivie reservoir to Coleman to Baird to Albany moving northeast at 30 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coleman, Clyde, Albany, Baird, Santa Anna, Cross Plains, Moran, Novice, Putnam, Rowden, Oplin, Eula, Dudley, Atwell, Burkett, Silver Valley, Glen Cove, Valera, Ibex and Talpa. - This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 295 and 323. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... I-20 Frontage Roads near Putnam, I-20 Frontage Roads west of Clyde, I-20 Frontage Roads near Baird, FM 1176 crossing Sweetie Creek, FM-RD 136 crossing Hords Creek, County Road 406 crossing Home Creek, County Road 485 crossing Indian Creek, County Road 482 crossing Jim Ned Creek, County Road 348 crossing Bull Creek and County Road 172 crossing Little Pecan Bayou. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
